tit.e: Kawawake TAKENUNA aka Kawawake no Mikoto TAKENUNA
Kawawake TAKENUNA aka Kawawake no Mikoto TAKENUNA
Kawawake TAKENUNA (aka Kawawake no Mikoto TAKENUNA)

sen.j: タケヌナカワワケ、タケヌナカワワケノミコトは『日本書紀』では武渟川別、『古事記』では建沼河別命と表記される、記紀に登場する人物。
sen.e: Kawawake TAKENUNA aka TAKENUNA Kawawake no Mikoto is noted in the classic Japanese book `Nihon Shoki` (Japan Chronicles) as `Kawawake TAKENUNA` but by a separate title (TAKENUNA Kawawake no Mikoto) in Kojiki (an ancient historical record of Japan).

Kawawake TAKENUNA aka TAKENUNA Kawawake no Mikoto is noted in the classic Japanese book `Nihon Shoki` (Japan Chronicles) as `Kawawake TAKENUNA` but by a separate title (TAKENUNA Kawawake no Mikoto) in Kojiki (an ancient historical record of Japan).

Kawawake TAKENUNA (aka TAKENUNA Kawawake no Mikoto) is noted in the classic Japanese book "Nihon Shoki" (Japan Chronicles) as Kawawake TAKENUNA but by a separate title (TAKENUNA Kawawake no Mikoto) in "Kojiki" (an ancient historical record of Japan).
sen.cmt: ダブルクォートカッコ追加

sen.e: TAKENUNA Kawawake no Mikoto
TAKENUNA Kawawake no Mikoto
TAKENUNA Kawawake no Mikoto
One of the `Shido Shoguns`: 4 shoguns who ruled different parts of Japan at the time.
One of the `Shido Shoguns`: 4 shoguns who ruled different parts of Japan at the time.
One of the 'Shido Shoguns': 4 shoguns who ruled different parts of Japan at the time.
Kawawake was a child of Obiko no Mikoto.
Kawawake was a child of Obiko no Mikoto.
Kawawake was a child of Obiko no Mikoto.
Kawawake was a forebear of the Abe Clan.
Kawawake was a forebear of the Abe Clan.
Kawawake was a forebear of the Abe Clan.

sen.j: 崇神天皇のとき、将軍として東海に派遣される。
sen.e: Kawawake was posted to the Tokai (Eastern region of Japan) as a Shogun during the reign of Emperor Sujin.
Kawawake was posted to the Tokai (Eastern region of Japan) as a Shogun during the reign of Emperor Sujin.
Kawawake was posted to the Tokai (Eastern region of Japan) as a Shogun during the reign of Emperor Sujin.

sen.j: 『古事記』によると、高志（越）の国の平定に向かった大彦命と相津（会津）で出会ったとされ、これが会津の地名の由来という。
sen.e: According to `Nihon Shoki` (Japan Chronicles), Obiko no Mikoto headed to Etsu Province to bring about control and became acquainted with Aizu (which was the origin of `Aizu` as a region name).
According to `Nihon Shoki` (Japan Chronicles), Obiko no Mikoto headed to Etsu Province to bring about control and became acquainted with Aizu (which was the origin of `Aizu` as a region name).
According to "Kojiki," Kawawake became acquainted with Obiko no Mikoto in Aizu (which was the origin of 'Aizu' as a region name) who was heading down to Etsu Province to bring about control.
sen.cmt: 原文解釈が違うと思うので再構成しました。

sen.j: また、天皇の命により吉備津彦と共に出雲振根を誅した。
sen.e: Also, following orders of the emperor, he killed both KIBITSUHI no Mikoto and Furune no IZUMO.
Also, following orders of the emperor, he killed both KIBITSUHI no Mikoto and Furune no IZUMO.
Also, following orders of the emperor, Kawawake together with Kibitsuhiko killed Izumo no Furune.
sen.cmt: 「共に」の解釈が違うと思うので再構成しました。
